meanings.def: happening or coming after all other similar things or people
examples: We caught the last bus home.
It's the last house on the left.
She was last to arrive.
This last point, which Hamish has mentioned, is crucial.
Her last words were for her children.

meanings.def: most recent
examples: last night/Tuesday/month/summer/year
The critics all hated her last book.
This last point is crucial.
The last time I saw him was in May.
Last summer we went to Greece for a month.
Shirley had a talk with her last Friday.

meanings.def: that is the only one that remains
examples: This is our last bottle of water.
He knew this was his last hope of winning.
I wouldn’t marry you if you were the last person on earth!
The teacher gave her one last chance to prove she could behave.
The museum is one of the last remnants of the 17th-century palace.
She was hanging on to the last remaining shreds of her reputation.
It took my last reserves of strength and will to swim to the lifeboat.

meanings.def: used to emphasize that somebody/something is the least likely or suitable
examples: The last thing she needed was more work.
He's the last person I'd trust with a secret.

meanings.def: after a long time
examples: At long last his prayers had been answered.

meanings.def: to be going to die or stop functioning very soon; to be very weak or in bad condition
the day, week, etc. just before the most recent one; two days, weeks, etc. ago
examples: I haven't seen him since the summer before last.

meanings.def: every person or thing in a group
examples: We spent every last penny we had on the house.

meanings.def: people sometimes say Famous last words! when they think somebody is being too confident about something that is going to happen
examples: ‘Everything's under control.’ ‘Famous last words!’

meanings.def: early in the morning/late in the evening
examples: I need the report on my desk first thing Monday morning.
I took the dog for a walk last thing before going to bed.

meanings.def: to be successful when you were not expected to be, making your opponents look stupid
examples: We'll have the last laugh if she finds out that you're the one who played the trick.

meanings.def: used to say what is most important after everything has been discussed, or considered
examples: In the final analysis, it's a matter of personal choice.

meanings.def: when there are no other possible courses of action
examples: In the last resort we can always walk home.

meanings.def: the last moment of a person’s life
the point at which you/something can no longer continue living, fighting, existing, etc.
the latest possible time before an important event
examples: They changed the plans at the last minute.
Don't leave your decision to the last moment.
Don't leave everything till the last minute.
Why do you leave it until the last possible moment before getting ready to leave?

meanings.def: the person or thing you rely on when everything else has failed
examples: I've tried everyone else and now you're my last resort.

meanings.def: the last in a series of bad events, etc. that makes it impossible for you to accept a situation any longer
the most recent, fashionable, advanced, etc. thing
examples: These apartments are the last word in luxury.

meanings.def: the last comment or decision about something
examples: He always has to have the last word in any argument.
I’m willing to wait one more week, and that’s my final word on the subject.
The Chairman always has the last word on financial decisions.

meanings.def: used to emphasize that something is true of all the people being described
examples: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.
They were all destroyed, to the last man.

meanings.def: seven days before the day that you mention
examples: She started work a week yesterday.

idioms.def: after a long time
examples: At long last his prayers had been answered.

idioms.def: to be going to die or stop functioning very soon; to be very weak or in bad condition

idioms.idiom: the day, week, month, etc. before last
idioms.def: the day, week, etc. just before the most recent one; two days, weeks, etc. ago
examples: I haven't seen him since the summer before last.

idioms.def: every person or thing in a group
examples: We spent every last penny we had on the house.

idioms.def: people sometimes say Famous last words! when they think somebody is being too confident about something that is going to happen
examples: ‘Everything's under control.’ ‘Famous last words!’

idioms.def: early in the morning/late in the evening
examples: I need the report on my desk first thing Monday morning.
I took the dog for a walk last thing before going to bed.

idioms.def: to be successful when you were not expected to be, making your opponents look stupid
examples: We'll have the last laugh if she finds out that you're the one who played the trick.

idioms.def: used to say what is most important after everything has been discussed, or considered
examples: In the final analysis, it's a matter of personal choice.

idioms.def: when there are no other possible courses of action
examples: In the last resort we can always walk home.

idioms.def: the last moment of a person’s life
the point at which you/something can no longer continue living, fighting, existing, etc.
the latest possible time before an important event
examples: They changed the plans at the last minute.
Don't leave your decision to the last moment.
Don't leave everything till the last minute.
Why do you leave it until the last possible moment before getting ready to leave?

idioms.def: the person or thing you rely on when everything else has failed
examples: I've tried everyone else and now you're my last resort.

idioms.idiom: the last/final straw | the straw that breaks the camel’s back
idioms.def: the last in a series of bad events, etc. that makes it impossible for you to accept a situation any longer
the most recent, fashionable, advanced, etc. thing
examples: These apartments are the last word in luxury.

idioms.def: the last comment or decision about something
examples: He always has to have the last word in any argument.
I’m willing to wait one more week, and that’s my final word on the subject.
The Chairman always has the last word on financial decisions.

idioms.idiom: to a man | to the last man
idioms.def: used to emphasize that something is true of all the people being described
examples: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.
They were all destroyed, to the last man.

idioms.idiom: a week yesterday, last Monday, etc.
idioms.def: seven days before the day that you mention
examples: She started work a week yesterday.

meanings.def: after anyone or anything else; at the end
examples: He came last in the race.
They arrived last of all.

meanings.def: most recently
examples: When did you see him last?
I saw him last/I last saw him in New York two years ago.
They last won the cup in 2006.

meanings.def: in every way that is important; completely
examples: She regarded herself, first and last, as a musician.

meanings.def: used to tell somebody not to be too proud of their present success; in the end another person may be more successful
used when mentioning the last person or thing of a group, in order to say that they are not less important than the others
examples: Last but not least, I'd like to thank all the catering staff.

meanings.def: used, for example in a situation when people are losing their jobs, to say that the last people to be employed will be the first to go

idioms.def: in every way that is important; completely
examples: She regarded herself, first and last, as a musician.

idioms.idiom: he who laughs last laughs longest
idioms.def: used to tell somebody not to be too proud of their present success; in the end another person may be more successful
used when mentioning the last person or thing of a group, in order to say that they are not less important than the others
examples: Last but not least, I'd like to thank all the catering staff.

idioms.def: used, for example in a situation when people are losing their jobs, to say that the last people to be employed will be the first to go

meanings.def: the person or thing that comes or happens after all other similar people or things
examples: Sorry I'm late—am I the last?
They were the last to arrive.

meanings.def: the only part or items that remain of something
examples: These are the last of our apples.
We finished the last of the milk at breakfast.

meanings.def: the latest
examples: That was the last I heard of him.

meanings.def: the least likely
examples: Known for their self-sufficiency, fishermen would be the last to admit to mental strain.

meanings.def: after much delay, effort, etc.; in the end
examples: At last we're home!
At long last the package arrived.
Lastly, I would like to thank my parents for all their support.
At last, after twenty hours on the boat, they arrived at their destination.

meanings.def: to die
from beginning to end; during the whole time
examples: It's a fine performance that commands attention from first to last.

meanings.def: to hear/see somebody/something for the last time
examples: That was the last I ever saw of her.
Unfortunately, I don't think we've heard the last of this affair.

meanings.def: used to give the most recent news you have about somebody/something
examples: The last I heard he was still working at the garage.

meanings.def: the one before the last one
examples: She finished second to last.

meanings.def: until the last possible moment, especially until death
examples: He died protesting his innocence to the last.

idioms.def: after much delay, effort, etc.; in the end
examples: At last we're home!
At long last the package arrived.
Lastly, I would like to thank my parents for all their support.
At last, after twenty hours on the boat, they arrived at their destination.

idioms.def: to die
from beginning to end; during the whole time
examples: It's a fine performance that commands attention from first to last.

idioms.def: to hear/see somebody/something for the last time
examples: That was the last I ever saw of her.
Unfortunately, I don't think we've heard the last of this affair.

idioms.def: used to give the most recent news you have about somebody/something
examples: The last I heard he was still working at the garage.

idioms.def: the one before the last one
examples: She finished second to last.

idioms.def: until the last possible moment, especially until death
examples: He died protesting his innocence to the last.

meanings.def: to continue for a particular period of time
examples: Each game lasts about an hour.
How long does the play last?
Nothing lasts forever.
last for something The meeting only lasted for a few minutes.
last until something The trial is expected to last until the end of the week.
The flight seemed to last forever.
The war lasted for three years.
The effort began in November and lasted through February.
The storm could last quite a long time.
a bruise that was sure to last for days
The celebrations lasted well into the next week.

meanings.def: to continue to exist or to function well
examples: This weather won't last.
Our product looks better and lasts longer.
He's making a big effort now, and I hope it lasts.
while something lasts It was fun while it lasted.
last somebody These shoes should last you till next year.
The kids are all very enthusiastic, but it won't last—it never does.
The good weather couldn't last.
This type of happiness rarely lasts.
Happiness never lasts.
I always thought his popularity was unlikely to last.
Interest rates are at their lowest level for a decade. I suggest you enjoy it while it lasts.
Make the most of this feeling while it lasts.
This house was built to last.
Your car will last longer if you look after it.
Even when cut, the flowers last very well.
With care, the vines will last indefinitely.

meanings.def: to survive something or manage to stay in the same situation, despite difficulties
examples: She won't last long in that job.
last out Can you last out until I can get help?
last something He was injured early on and didn't last the match.
last out something Doctors say that she probably won't last out the night (= she will probably die before the morning).

meanings.def: to be enough for somebody to use, especially for a particular period of time
examples: last out Will the coffee last out till next week?
last somebody We’ve got enough food to last us (for) three days.
last (+ adv./prep.) She hoped they had enough firewood to last through the night.
Get your free sample while supplies last!
How long do you think this storm will last?
The movie lasted over two hours.
His annoyance won’t last.
The money she gave us should last until next week.
It takes (me) at least an hour to get home from work.
How long will the flight take?
The water took ages to boil.

meanings.def: a block of wood or metal in the shape of a foot, used in making and repairing shoes
